FbOuOQsGNKAs1j-N_Q7TEg.text: I love everything about this place. The burrito bowl with guacamole feels a bit expensive, but when I want fast food without feeling fat, this is the place. Not only is the food perfect, the vibe is awesome. I'm not sure how they do it, but Chipolte makes me feel glad to be alive. Maybe it's the unfinished wood, the music, or employees who actually seem happy.  I experienced a hiccup when I ordered over the phone, however. I was rushing to work and wanted to pick up some Chipotle. The food wasn't ready when I arrived 15 minutes later. They wanted to make it on the spot, but I didn't have time to wait. They made it up to me by providing a free bowl another day after I called to ask what happened.

OaHXI0WZl-UXZ00f4Erqlg.text: Rice and guacamole is not fresh at all. Rice seems like it was store in fridge over night. Will not visit the store where owner trying to cut corners.

E3Jbwg0nk8bWdrdOa6kc4Q.text: Since my first visit to Chipotle maybe six weeks ago, I have been numerous times.  Service is very fast and the food is freshly made the way you like it.  The wraps are huge and will fill you to capacity (not me, I could only eat ate half).  I love the salad as it is, again, made the way you like it.  I am anxiously awaiting a Chipotle restaurant in  the Northern part of Charlotte.  They just have not made it up this far as yet.  So, when I am near downtown or in South Charlotte, I am always up to eat at Chipotle.  Umm Umm good! It's like Salsarita's only better!

qP7XtI6jJ-aCenSN1CrVLw.text: I got take out here once, and my order was ready, pronto. Went straight to the pick up line.   Quick, professional, and not amatuers here. Very nice!

nEmpiDd7vebEoBQ2NlulTw.text: I have been a Chipotle fan since the good ol' days when there were only two Chipotles and they were both in Denver. Amen. I smuggled their bulging burritos in my carry-on on long flights between DIA and Logan in between semesters... But I digress. And I'm dating myself. Alas, I am thankful that the chained-up version of Chipotle is strikingly similar to the original. Truly. And while it could have gone el-cheapo and sourced questionable ingredients from more questionable sources, their business model is founded on securing the freshest ingredients possible - and getting meats raised humanely without antibiotics and hormones. Word. That being said, I still order vegetarian, but this is the one fast-food place I will take my kiddos.   Chipotle is very kid friendly, perfect for a quick snack, or a big dinner. It is great as an eat-in meal or takeout in a large brown paper bag. If you are pressed for time, order online. This spot has five prime parking spots right by the front door for online or fax orders. This location is busy, but I never seem to stand in line for too long and my meal(s) are prepared super quick.   My personal favorite ... vegetarian burrito bowl made with brown cilantro lime rice, black beans and fajita veggies, mild salsa, medium corn salsa, and a little bit of spicy hot salsa, shredded cheese, lettuce, and, of course, guacamole. Delicious. It takes me two meals to finish it. Portions are huge! Bonus for me ... easy to order gluten-free for me and my girls. The boys and hubs can get a burrito as big as their heads and we all are happy campers. Well fed, happy campers.

CqYEAIUxL127c68S54rqMw.text: Much, much better than the location in Matthews. They always give me great portions and aren't concerned if I get an extra piece of chicken.  I just wish that they can soon find a provider for carnitas since that is my favorite meat to put in my bowl.

O6qKhBreLYOLNd5PtnMXjw.text: I think the wheels have come off at this one. I walked out of a Chipotle for the first time ever - heartbreaking. Big carnitas guy and sign said No Carnitas. Ok. I'll go another route. Line was 8 deep. It took 16 minutes to get up to the front. I was in a hurry so I was watching the time. The guy in front of me ordered a burrito. The server gave him a little more than a teaspoon of rice. Fair serving of beans. When he asked for chicken, she scraped and scraped an essentially empty pan and gave him an embarrassing amount. That was the tipping point and I walked out. Come on Chipotle. I need you.

hzgPvQ8Knwj4gQ3AVC2SrQ.text: This is the absolute worst Chipotle. Every time I go the food is ice cold, my order is messed up, and there is no organization. It takes 25 minutes to get my food every time. I guess they are lucky there's not a lot of options around because this place sucks!

5mhriN2lLfxSJZIol5tHww.text: It's really great to see Midtown getting some more love. While much of it is filled with chains, it's still progress. And I like progress.   Situated next to Vitamin World is this new Chipotle. The resto is chock full of clean and shiny tables, smiley employees and swift service. The offerings are typical of other Chipotles - burritos, tacos, burrito bowls, quesadillas, fountain beverages, etc. Yes, they charge for guacamole like all the other Chipotles. But hey, they do say that their focus is on "food with integrity," and that's pretty cool for a fast-ish food chain.   The side patio is nice to grab a seat and take in some fresh area while you mow down your burrito of choice. There aren't any sweet views from the patio, but hey, outside is outside in CLT.

1PJxBwg2b2yyH4ZjKG13iw.text: Great meal!  Could do a better job of spreading out guac and sour cream but overall tasty.  Great staff, very friendly!

OgD0A7VOxtkqFZFus0k78g.text: The food here is good and the place is nice...not super clean but I didn't expect that clean of a place around lunch time...I got a burrito, chips and a drink a bit  pricey for just that.  The burrito was good nothing special about it...but what really stood out were their chips. Those are the best chips I have ever eaten, so good you don't even need salsa fit them.  If I were to go back it would be to get more chips.

-RSdxMSNDTit3oikqh_wPg.text: Chipotle is always a great place to go.  I am visiting Charlotte for a conference and the vegetarian options aren't that vast, so go with what you know. I have been there three times. The staff is one of the best I have encountered.  Only one complaint, the music was a bit too loud.

t3KIOu_83YnKDKtIiZmhDQ.text: I was SO excited about this location opening up so close to where I live, as I practically grew up on Chipotle (starting back in 2000 in San Diego). My first opportunity, I made an order online and picked-up on my way to class. However, I was a little let down.  First, my online order was not ready at the designated time, despite it not being busy. Someone just dropped the ball. Oh well, slightly annoying, but forgivable as there was no one else in line and I could oversee the construction of my bowl.  The fajita mix (peppers and onions) looked a little old and over-cooked. It happens sometimes and I figured that I just got there after a lull. No biggie.   When it came time to leave, there was confusion about how to use the system, as it was a pre-paid online order. It took about a minute to clear up, but was thinking that for a brand-new location the staff should be better trained. Still, I calmed myself and ran through my imaginative happy place where Chipotle guacamole runs in rivers and their salty-lemony chips grow on trees.  However, the the final let down arrived when I started eating the barbacoa bowl. The barbacoa was rather dry and clumped together--immune to even repeated stabbings and twistings with a fork. Nothing could de-tangle it. I had to eat it more like meat on a stick style, which was actually a  little bit of a turn off and made for a unsatisfied Chipotle experience.  Put together, I was let down. I was expecting more for a brand new location. Perhaps the staff needs more time to get into the groove of things and maybe Chipotle should step up their training program a bit too.  I'll be back again soon to see how things have progressed, but please don't let me down again! My heart (and stomach) just couldn't handle it.

IoOCqRsN6Ag0fp6GvdndNg.text: Everytime I go here, there is something wrong. Once, (about 25 mins before closing) they were out of chips, brown rice and cheese. They would not put out anymore even though several customers were in line. The next time I went, the rice was very hard and undercooked. I went again a couple days ago and they were out of 2 of the 3 kinds of Tabasco sauces.

XxRwGP_ajw6idnbtZm-dFg.text: 1st time there. I didn't appreciate being rushed. The staff had a nonchalant attitude. Get u in Get u out. Food is ok. Nothing special.

VMOZKNXz-fLGcBkAT0hFjQ.text: I am such an idiot for believing this food poisoning thing was over. Don't make the same mistake I did!! I went tonight (2/27), had a steak bowl, and spent the wee morning hours throwing up & in the worst stomach pain of my life. Guess what people! It's not over. Reporting to CDC in the morning. RIP Chipotle. I will miss you.

JHxSO2WCjtwIODtqRj5MXA.text: I love chipotle but this one kind of sucks. Sure I came in late, but an hour before closing everything was shut down. They had no chips or guac and the remaining rice was hard and undercooked. Maybe it's fine in the middle of the day but everyone working here was more concerned with closing procedures than dealing with the lengthening line. Again I would have understood if I came in 3 mins before closing, but I was handed my burrito in a to go bag and the hint was definitely to get out!

PvO3-cawVeVRJjZy31ZxWA.text: I absolutely love this place not just because their environmentally friendly and because most of the vegetables and dairy products are hormone and pesticide free!!! But because its good healthy fast food especially when your in a hurry the prices are reasonable and the workers are friendly !

pnd23hvkvyqpg0q1GgdwAw.text: Big fan of Chipotle as it is much better than any Moe's or Qdoba I have visited. This location is great; service is quick and friendly, food is delicious. As with most Chipotle locations, seating is limited for those not taking it to-go.

ASd9byLcjE_QMYiPMtjDrw.text: Its a bit overwhelming how many fast food burrito chains exist and what really sets them apart. Moes you get free chips, Qdoba has really good rice and Chipotle is apparently all organic? I am all for organic so I had to check them out. When I arrived the line was nearly out the door but the service moved at a steady pace. I got a chicken burrito with everything in it, including guac. I swear it weighed three pounds which had me wondering if I could finish it, but in the end I destroyed it. I am not sure if it was the organicness or some sort of organic placebo effect but I did not feel nasty full. The burrito also tasted much fresher than the other two burrito chains mentioned. What really decided the four star rating though was the guac, I LOVE chunky guac and I was coming up with quarter sized pieces of avocado NOM.

xycz0oXfxDRdGX5MEEm3iA.text: Love visiting this place when going to classes at CPCC on central campus.  The food is great and always quick service.  They have a nice outdoor sitting area.  I enjoy the steak burrito while the wife always gets a bowl, and the spices have always been just right for me.  Not too spicy but enough flavor to give a little kick..  The best part of this location is walking over to the Cherry Berry in the Metropolitan Shopping center for desert.

7YOyV-HQnWur2WeDPlSRng.text: Service is very slow.  Rarely do I see anyone wipe of the tables, even when it's slow.  Restaurant employees park in the closest spaces to the restaurant, just shows how there is no management skills there.  Always see people filling up their water cups with soda, that's just stealing, not to mention it drives up the prices. Luckily the food has never been a problem.

6orSy0O5N1zRgqymjNOV3A.text: Been here MANY, MANY times, in fact, I might go here in a few minutes.  This is slowly becoming my new favorite burrito spot.  For me, its the steak that makes the difference taste-wise.  Their steak is very juicy and succulent, and has almost a smokey/grilled flavor it to it.     Their service is usually pretty good.  Although I feel the employees sometimes go too far out of their way to speak and/or joke with you - which I don't mind, but sometimes its excessive.  Otherwise the service is good and they are more than willing to accommodate whatever your specific burrito needs are.  There is usually ample parking and easy access from whichever entrance you choose (that's what she said ;-)).  The inside, though sometimes crowded, is usually clean enough to stay and eat, if you like.    Friends tell me the bowls and salads are good as well, but I am yet to try either.  I always run the burrito - steak, peppers and onions, plenty of cheese, sour cream and guac, with hot salsa -  NOW that's good eating folks!  (The previous review was written in loving honor of Cinco De Mayo...)

daKg3E51iWKCUTnX2WsWEg.text: The line is typically always long and very busy there at this location but the employees are always very fast and productive! They definitely keep the line moving!! I actually got here before the rush showed up and when I was finishing getting my drink and ready to walk out the door...all I needed was a straw! It took 10 mins to get one straw....ridiculous!! I'll give them a pass because service is typically great! But I didn't appreciate being ignored after asking for a straw!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Burrito #nomnom

LnTqfZhkFVATjJli3zhQHg.text: I haven't been to a chipotle a while so I asked the young lady a question about the different beans and rices. She looked at me like I was crazy. I felt very rushed. I picked steak and she only gave me half a spoon full and most of it was fat. Usually I love chipotle but my experience at this particular one wasn't very pleasant.

iP483JawkO8zVYell4X5yw.text: Is it just me or are The burritos and bowls getting smaller? This is been my second time to this chipotle and the taste quality and size are just not what I expected. I've eaten at chipotle for a while now and it seems like things are getting smaller but quality is getting worse. I guess this is what happens when you get too big. I will not be going back to this chipotle or even any of them they just lost their appeal to me.

F8nLL3Mcdu09897vBiO97g.text: I don't know who is running this place but this is the slowest chipotle I've ever been to and today is the third time I've come and they don't have food prepared. I wanted steak and they were out. The last time, they were out of fajita veggies and the time before that they were out of rice. What gives? I love chipotle so two stars but this location leaves much to be desired.

hkh3ALTt_n8kblwlFQnbWA.text: At first, I'll admit I held a grudge against Chipotle for not having queso. Finally one day I asked "WHY NO QUESO?! WHY??" The employee responded by telling me Chipolte strives to have fresh (locally sourced if possible) ingredients. After I let my hankering' for queso go, I started to truly appreciate how superior Chipolte was to other burrito chains in terms of quality.  I've been to a few all over Charlotte, but I think the staff here is the best. I really love that most Chipotle's are open until 10pm!!  Thumbs up for being "fast food" and vegetarian friendly. Veggie burrito is just as big and filling as the carnivore options. I dig the Roasted Chili-Corn Salsa with just a bit of the hot Tomatillo-Red Chili Salsa on my burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. HAPPINESS, wrapped in a giant piece of foil to-go!

e8vG3IkWO67XjVXkoV2jmw.text: What's the purpose of offering web orders if you can't get them right?   Today, for the FOURTH time in a row, my order came back to me wrong!   Not acceptable!

HFYIN_WYDTtc7AlkYjuqsQ.text: In an effort to start eating healthier, we opted to go to Chipotle today to satisfy our craving for a burrito.  First of all, they have an iPhone app you can order directly off of,  with their full menu -  toppings & chips & drink offerings. You can choose to pay on the app or pay inside the restaruant. Already I was a happy girl!  They gave us a 20 minute pickup time.  When we arrived, people started piling in.  Lucky enough, they have two spaces reserved for iPhone, online & fax orders. Another plus!  When my boyfriend went inside at 1:15 PM, they were finishing up our order, he paid & came right back out. Yes, another plus!  When we got home (about a 15 minute drive), our burritos were still hot inside the foil Yum! My chicken burrito with fajita mix and tomatillo green salsa was delicious. The chicken was seasoned just right & the fajita vegetables season was spicy. And the chips...crisp & flavorful, with the lime & salt. The guacamole was fresh & not mushy.   Other notes: Not a huge place, but they do have a nice patio area with ample seating. Boyfriend said the employees were nice & the inside was clean. The prices do seem a bit high.  The biggest plus of all: eating the burrito & half the bag of chips, I didn't feel fat & yucky!

nIY2tL6W2S11JpwfqciosQ.text: Nice to see another Chipotle pop up in the area. There's no shortage of traffic on Charlottetown Ave....  This place is a little larger than typical chipotle setups.... Line starts on the left instead of right and the inside still has the industrial feel.  The tables are laid out with high counter stools and a couple of regular height tables.  Patio area is pretty killer.  Good place to do some people watching.  Staff is super nice... You could kind of tell they are still training but no huge mistakes.  Everything is clean and makes for a solid, predictable experience every time.

2JkoiyjsT5zLVm1_wpcSeQ.text: I am on a roll here.  Two Chipotles in 2 weeks.  I am glad to see there's another faster type of food in this area of town.  There aren't may other options especially if you wanted something that is fairly healthy.  Getting into the parking lot can be a challenge. If you are coming from CPCC, you either have to make a left onto 3rd street and then turn right on Charlottetowne Ave or go up to Charlotttetown Ave and make a u-turn which can be challenging but unlike some other Chipotles, there is plenty of parking.  It shares its parking lot with a Vitamin World and a mattress store.   Inside the restaurant, they have bar tables but like any chipotle I've been in, I find their restaurants to be sterile with no real character.  But I guess most people come here for the food.  I am really starting to appreciate Chipotles food.  This time I opted for a burrito bowl with chicken, sans rice and added guac, and a couple different types of salsa.  Got it to go as I was in a hurry to get home.  Great flavors.  I really enjoy their hot salsa.  Service was good here.  People were friendly.  They do not have liquor yet but there is a sign saying liquor license is pending.  Overall a good experience...i just don't care for the sterile restaurant seating area. So that's why they get a 3.

HpA76ZqDmwkYk3uXNqPyrA.text: This chipotle is slacking... I was there earlier today to find semen all over the toilet when I went to use the restroom... then I ordered my food and the steak was dry and hard while the rice tasted like I was eating rocks. And on top of all that I will never ever forget how there was just spit dripping down the door as I walked out. What an experience

6Z-gcg14x0Wzakrk9iDSag.text: Chipotle. Rocks. My. World.  My staple order:  chicken burrito (or bowl depending if I feel "civilized") with brown rice, black beans.  I don't know if I've ever strayed from my ultimate topping combo... pico de gallo (the chopped tomato mild sauce), a little hot sauce, corn, sour cream, and cheese.  Can you say PERFECT?!!  The guacamole also rocks, although it costs extra.  I also throw in the sauteed peppers/onions when I do the bowl.  You can't go wrong...chipotle heaven.  As far as service, always friendly considering how busy this place can get.  The line can literally be to the door during peak hours.  The price you pay for heaven I guess.  However, they always seem well staffed and the line moves faster than you would think possible.  And last, but certainly not least.  Patron margaritas?!  This must be a recent addition because I only noticed the sign today.  Nothing like a cold margarita (or beer) to go with my burrito...   Keep up the good work!!

ZSoqroEEXlu5N6cCSfUBkQ.text: I can see this location from my balcony at the Met. It's convenient to say the least. I haven't been to this location in a while and yesterday was a reminder why. They tend to be short staffed or the staff doesn't multitask well. I ordered a bowl and once everything was finished, instead of cashing me out and sending me on my way, my food sat there for several minutes while two burritos were finished (by indecisive customers so calculate that in also). Wasn't impressed with the service but it won't keep me from going back. I will place to go orders for now on. Food is rocking!

YBXv6XaaTYm7btk7zhEw1A.text: Well, let's just keep the Chipotle train goin'! Nothing but great things to say about the staff at this joint, the always stellar burrito, burrito bowl, salad, and anything with copious amount of guac. Never a complaint to be found from this side when it comes to the menu.   I will, however, say that the access for this location is simply atrocious. Good luck gaining entrance into the pygmy-style parking lot they have going on here....ever. Unless you're coming from Elizabeth on Charlottetowne or from Dilworth/Myers Park on Kings, you're screwed. Only two entrances to be found. Take your pick, do a U-turn if need be, THEN commence enjoyment.

seYWfNh7nb3vrnNuoC_fjg.text: I never get the right portions here. Sometimes my bowl is overflowing and then days like today I received half a scoop of rice, half a scoop of chicken, I had to ask for more salsa and cheese. And on top of it the girl tried to give me a side of guac that was half full. I then asked her to fill up the side cup of guac and was given attitude. When my bowl is half filled do I get to pay half price? I think you guys need a better training program for your employees so that people are getting the same portion sizes all the time. I have also been in here many times when they are out of chips, or cheese, or guac, or veggies at the end of the night and don't replace anything in the last hour or so.

AdcC_J5vEh9e6Gz-gQV_Xw.text: Yummy, yummy Chipotle.  They are not stingy with their fillings, and everything seems fresh. The workers are also very nice.  I like their outdoor seating option. It's nice to feel a good breeze, with the warmth of the sun, all while eating a delicious burrito.

ughAsyN8RuH4tFMSxs91MQ.text: Chipotle takes the cake for me.  I like Chipotle better than Moes or Salsaritas for two reasons:   the spice on the chicken and the white rice.  (They also have brown rice but I am addicted to the flavor of the white!!)  All of the rest is normal - different heats of salsa and the usual toppings.  I always get the burrito bowl - the friendly folks that work there will walk you through the ordering process in case you are a newbie :-)  Most Chipotles sell beer - yay!!  This location is still working on getting its permits to sell it.  (Remember the 'Noon' Rule here in NC).    This location is located on the corner of Central across the street from Target.  It is a small location with a patio and tables outside.

f2lZZHRESDaUDgZ1Zo0tPw.text: Chipotle has quickly become a staple for my roommate and i on indecisive dinner nights or hangover sundays.  while still a chain, they have avoided the manufactured taste by constantly offering fresh ingredients. personally, nothing quite hits the spot like a steak burrito bowl and the ample servings leave me hard pressed to finish. the midtown location is quaint, but feels like it has more of a carry-out vibe to it.

VzwaRQTVNnTc3Oq3Q45OEw.text: Believe or not my first visit came just the other week.  Everyone raves about Chipotle and I too can see why.  Is it my favorite? Probably not.  I'm a Moe's fan really when it comes to burritos.    They do have great fresh ingredients and the staff is as kind and friendly as any you will find though.   This location I imagine can be a bit of trouble getting in and out of considering it's location is on a busy corner with the MET across the street.

e-WY43hcVuMTldXaQGYTzw.text: I can't say anything bad about this place.. I LOVE IT. Clearly I have been here about 3 times this week. Add some salad dressing to your burrito bowl. You will thank me later.

x3xNSrtMm4TbL7ko8rMpYw.text: These guys never disappointing. Love Chipotle. Wish there was a rewards program as much as I shop here.

YSQJAeZ9pNlL0WF7DK4mlQ.text: Literally best customer service IN LIFE! I called at around 9:50pm on a Sunday night because I went to the Chipotle on South Blvd and they were out of meat- was caught at a red light and got a CALL BACK! I was able to do my order over the phone - MIND BLOWN! To top it off the customer service was great and my order was perfect !!!! Overall this chipotle was clean, the food was made prompt and fresh, the eating area was well kept and well stocked with napkins, lids, etc. and the staff were excited to serve

cNKC3Z6uhzKLmP4FNmUnkw.text: I know this is low-budget, spin on Latin cuisine, but yeah...I love it!    The staff is always friendly & fast.  Food is replaced immediately and is always hot!  Extra points for special requests being handled with pleasant efficiency.  Hmmm, rethinking only 4 stars.... :)  I can be cold-natured (not emotionally), but am I the only one that is cold?  I'm thinking the one thermostat is in the kitchen.    But hey!  It's simply good and I've become a bit addicted.  Aclamaciones!

iBgODsR_RlDGfgyr4M_nzQ.text: A little upset I paid 6 bucks for chips and queso, and I get home and the chips are not in the bag.  I guess I didn't notice after the cashier dunked my receipt in the bag and didn't say thank you. I'll satisfy my cravings back at the South Blvd location in the future.

77OnFZhLvifK30v9z50QZQ.text: Best run Chipotle I've experienced. Hector is excellent. Staff is friendly, fast, and competent.

2lTi5_SxDPXgmFSnsGD7pg.text: One of my favorite lunch & dinner options so not really much to discuss. Since being cleared by the  CDC of being E Coli free I'm finally eating here more often.   Having moved from the Northeast, I'm use to waiting in lines for lunch/dinner but felt like the line this night was extremely long. This was my first visit to this location so maybe this is normal. Felt like the service was very slow but I'm in the south now so maybe this is what I need to expect going forward lol. Culture shocked   Anyway it's fast food so nothing bad, great location, food was good & Chipotle quality so I was satisfied.

RI0EKyvA2nSW_YRjQPMi2w.text: I don't often consume fast food, but if I find myself in a pinch I will go to Chipotle. I feel as though they are more responsible with where they source their ingredients than other fast food places.   I always get the salad with chicken, black beans, guacamole, etc. I love their guacamole. I will eat it until I am sick b/c I just can't stop.   I went this evening and even at 9pm there was a line of 13 people. I do not think they were properly staffed for this. I got to the front of the line and they were out of vegetables. I had to wait another 5 minutes while the vegetables were cooked. There was a traffic jam at the cash register, which was backing everything else up. Needless to say, it wasn't qualified as "fast food" this evening.

MqaM9yb0svgO_ej_1lxnMw.text: This is a great place for Sunday lunch. The location is in the center of midtown, a happening place to be!  You can easily walk, in less than 3 minutes, to Target, Best Buy, Trader Joe's, Vitamin Shoppe, and many more places.  The food at Chipotle is always great and the service is always top rate.  Although I will say that I went in to eat a few weeks ago and the manager was doing business paperwork on the tables in the dining room area.  Not a great place to conduct managerial duties of paperwork completion.   Especially when you are taking up valuable real estate in the dining room!!    So, they do no have queso here because it is processed.  It would be great to find a queso that is able to be manufactured without harsh stabilizing chemicals, but this certainly doesn't take away from the fantastic menu options currently available.    The outside patio area is great for dogs and people alike.  There are select tables with umbrellas, so arrive prior to busy hour to reserve your shaded table.     There is a mattress store beside of Chipotle, so if you eat too much then you can go "test mattresses" in a nicely cooled and comfortable mattress store!  Ha!!    Enjoy your experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. Yumm!!

XzUBtaeH2B6n431JaBxUcg.text: Very attentive staff even though it was a Tuesday lunch rush and the line was practically out the door. Highly recommend online ordering for the lunch rush. Great location after Christmas shopping at target!

aU6s5ZwSq1NVsJgZNWhuQw.text: Smallest burrito ever. Asked for a little more chicken and he told me no. Come to find out they were out of chicken and he was too lazy to refill it. Two stars is being generous! Boo Chipotle!

3rqGm7wivPudqFHyfNqmlA.text: I like Chipotle, but the corn is always frozen! I don't know why? Guacamole is great. Carnitas is delicious. The staff doesn't seem to like making quesadillas though. Maybe the corn is always frozen when I go because I go for lunch.

BCaFg4nXLdmnwwsZ0xPlEA.text: This is the slowest Chipotle I've ever been to.  It always takes forever regardless of how many people are waiting in line.  They never seem to have the right number of people working the line.  Today I came in, the line was out the door and they only had two people working up front.  There seemed to be a bunch of people standing around in the back not doing much of anything.  Also, they usually skimp on portions at this particular location.  Came through the other day and they literally gave me half a scoop of rice and not even a full spoonful of chicken.  The only reason I come here is because it's conveniently located on my way home.  The food is still good which is why I didn't give one star, but man, they have some work to do in terms of service.

8MmraCr8A0xZIM1m7fdK3A.text: Disappointed with this Chipotle location. The employees are very skimpy with portions. If I'm going to pay you for a bowl, you should give me enough to fill the bowl! I understand that the employees are probably concerned about running out of food. This falls now on the cooks and management. Make more food to serve your paying customers and keep portion size consistent. If I wanted a kids meal I would have ordered one.   Another thing, I got a bowl recently and it had hard pieces of idk what in it!!  Not cool or ok!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. I got a bowl recently and it had hard pieces of idk what in it!!  Not cool or ok!!!!

Lh6_zmXJyoLKd5nqMtFtjQ.text: Worst service ever!! Placed an order by fax for five people in our office. Called to verify it was received. Arrived at the designated time. Girl behind the cash register couldn't find my order - even though I repeated SEVERAL times that I'd faxed it in. Finally a young girl said she had my order and was just finishing it. No... the manager came FIFTEEN minutes later and pulled it out from under the work station. It had been completed before I even arrived. So I waited fifteen plus minutes to get my now lukewarm food with wilted and brown lettuce.

u_2dhcR72rowti48rX0WOw.text: I really like chipotle. I've stuck in despite long lines, bad news, and more. I used to go at least every couple of weeks. A couple days ago, some friends said they went to this location and that they were out of a lot of toppings. I was doubtful, but it made me crave it again, so I stopped in today. I ordered a bowl and wanted guac. In fact, I like guac because it helps balance out the heat in some of the other ingredients. However, I was told it would be FIFTEEN minutes before there'd be more guac. FIFTEEN. Like, toss me the avocados. I'll smash em up for you.

7HQd557ab6ypZ21L5awFmQ.text: Service was good, but food not so good.. Came in at 5pm, start of dinner rush right? Shouldn't everything be fresh? Nope.. chicken was old stale tasting, like it's been sitting for a while. Chips were like chewy cardboard, soo stale! Like no crunch at all!! I'm paying almost 2 bucks for chips that were made like a week ago.. no thanks.

l8oQekQLbRjhQVEkT8m9JA.text: I've always enjoyed Chipotle. It's fresh, hot, employees have been friendly and efficient, and the ingredients are good stuff.  I get the chicken bowls for the most part with hot salsa, corn salsa and grilled veggies with brown rice. It's so satisfying and if you get it to go, it still tastes good if you don't get to it for about 30 mins.  They also offer beer and margaritas if you eatin in.

BWjqEiNphTQ5DFhXeycvrg.text: This place gives you literally 1/4 the size bowl that other chipotle do. I don't have a huge appetite and I feel like I have to beg for them to put more toppings on every time. I'd suggest driving the extra mile and going to another franchise.

G5FprXwZ7Ps57AfY1neOOg.text: The silver burrito looks good but has let me down for the final time.  The more I have visited Chipotle over the years the more I realize how lazy they have gotten with their one-item menu. There meat and salsa have become so bland you're almost better cooking your own at home with some marinade.  Many competitors have popped up over the years that are not Mexican food joints but direct "burrito only" type competitors and have given Chopotle a run for their money. While I don't see them going out of business any time soon, they sure need to get their act together. With the recent reveal of almost an entire GMO menu, I have one more reason besides flavor to never return.  Goodbye Chipotle, for good.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States. The silver burrito looks good but has let me down for the final time.

45KO31eA79LzlhNDMsaOEw.text: This location is probably the most busy one in Charlotte, at least of the 3 that I've visited here. Line for lunch and or dinner can be wrapped around the seating area and sometimes nearly out the door. Limited seating area but there's normally always a spot to sit. I'm not really big on the cleaning habits I've seen on several occasions tables left dirty and no one paying much attention to the matter. The bathroooms are acceptable but could use a deep cleaning. Staff is not too friendly but if I served burritos to half of uptown traffic everyday I probably would feel a little annoyed sometimes too! Overall you can't go wrong with a chipotle bowl or burrito. Great grab and go option or night out eating with the family. Casual dining experience for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

AGV8oue_HzN5S1Yff9w3UQ.text: I love chipotle but the employees at this location don't love there job. The staff is unwelcoming, not friendly, have stale looks on their faces, and dry times. LIKE EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM! It's crazy that the whole staff is that bad, not one single smile, hello, can I get you anything else nothing!  I ordered a salad with chicken and fajitas, at first I was barely given a scoop of chicken and when I said something he just looked at me and scooped another half scoop.  The fajitas where at the very end and he did ask for them multiple times while I was in line but the girl he was speaking to just ignored him, then when she finally came over was just like "um didn't think you were really out" When I got to the register I wanted to use my birthday chips and guac, the cashier was like I don't know, and I said well I scan it here and she was just like sure. I asked did it go through she said I guess. I said before I hand you my card I want to be sure and she said "it looks like it". I pay and she pushes my bag to me. I leave just to get in my car and drive off to see she didn't put my guac in the bag. Went back in it was just sitting on the counter, as I walk up she just hands it to me and gives me a stale look. Won't be back at this location.

IUA2ZUTPodBEAveSwyunSw.text: This was my worst experience at Chipotle! My boyfriend decided to eat here after driving 3 hours. We were tired and hungry. We both love chipotle so it was an easy decision to make. The store was not busy at all And all personnel appeared to be annoyed by every guest in the restaurant.   For the record we arrived more than 2 hours before closing. We both order bowls, but the workers seemed To annoyed by our topping requests. Aren't we able to pick what toppings we want.   Neither of us were on our phones or engaging with one Another. We wanted to make sure that we were fully engaged with the staff.  I asked the cashier for chips, she replied "we ain't got none". Remember it's 2 hours before closing. I said o okay. Then she stares at me. I had to ask what was the total or she was going to stare at me forever.  She mumbles the total under her breath. At this point we grab our stuff and go. We were so dissatisfied with the service, i don't think we will return to this location.  I recommend to anyone if you want enjoy your food Options in peace do not eat here

TvUDLrWGx-E8NJmePXNCYQ.text: I love chipotle, so it's not easy to give a bad review. Super  frustrated and disappointed. I asked for salad dressing prior to my salad bowl being made & asked if they had any. She said yes. I pay for my salad bowl & remind the cashier that I wanted dressing. He tells me they are out. Wtf am I supposed to do with a dry ass salad and this isn't the first time this has happened which is why I now ask BEFORE the salad is made If there is any.   Also, the fajitas that was given to me was scraped and burnt when I should have been given fresh fajitas. I wasn't even given a full serving. I also wasn't given a full serving of the lettuce (which was the lettuce that typically goes on top & that lettuce had to be used because they had ran out), along with the stingy 1/3 of a scoop of guac I received. Highly disappointed & expected better to be honest.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

RFXOvXTlWlnEzZV9woacdw.text: Food was pretty good but we were charged full price for a large water just as if it were a soda.  Somehow that just doesn't seem right.  $3/4 for a cup of water ...,.

vZtXd5FKIVnh4nZy04QokA.text: I don't often get to Chipotle, and this one in particular. I think it is due to their location. Though it is not badly situated, they are not easy to spot, and the entrance is tucked in so that you see them from the parking lot and not from the road. Makes perfect sense if you're parking, but if you're passing on the road you can easily zip by without any idea that they are even there. I have to keep that in mind.  Regardless, it's a decent spot to pop into for a bite, especially for lunch, provided you get there at the right time. 11:30? Generally good. 11:35? Prepare to wait. Seriously. I walked in one day and literally walked right up to the register. By the time I was paying for my order - which took a minute longer than perhaps it should since I was behind a DoorDash/Uber Eats/whatever pickup - the line went all the way back to the door. Guess that maybe I'm the only one who can't figure out that they are there.  Regardless, it's a nice spot if you hit it right, and you can sit there and watch the folks who get there at the wrong time, or take your order to go and eat it later (or just order and let that DoorDash guy do the work.

b-41HBUoGbQmZne3ceOJtA.text: Chipotle Mexican Grill was, in my experience, one if the originators of the fast-casual dining concepts that have become ubiquitous. The fact that it has stuck around is a testament to it's commitment to high-quality, natural ingredients prepared in-house.  The location of this Chipotle is incredibly convenient. Since parking can be an issue, Chipolte has designated certain spots for carry-out orders, which I suspect makes up a large portion of their business.  My main issue with Chipotle is the price, which I believe is excessive, especially when it comes to guacamole. Guacamole should be included in the price of the item, not an additional added cost.  Chipotle can be quick and healthy, and in this world of McDonald's and Burger King that must be supported.

IIUqcjWmWtG1_ConruINmA.text: Super slow when their busy & waiting on the to go order took forever. Even with multiple people working behind the counter, they don't keep up with the amount of people.

Zct4KfI-LvqUSchFgXv9RQ.text: The counters where the chipotle was being wrapped was dirty and they were not paying attention to my order. I went home and my food was marked wrong.

16dsvgBgEEQoANn0JIDd7w.text: For the love of everything holy DO NOT order online here.... I have 3 times now and each time it takes longer and longer to get what I ordered. This is branch is not ran very well and is very disorganized.

aeIzpmnzDGuFJ-QL0GNwHA.text: Just recently went to Chipotle and it was the worst culinary experience I've had in recent memory. The food was terrible, the service was awful. It took 20minutes to receive our burritos or tacos. When I spoke to the manager he was belligerent and disrespectful. I thought they would be at least one adult in the room .  Strangely enough I think there was font  as a team was impressive.  They had each other's back  and firmly took  the opinion that  nothing could be done about the service and wait time, and that my demands were irrational. I can appreciate that sort of corporate loyalty  and franchise  dishonesty . It's something you can train for.  "if any customers complain about the wait time or food be sure to form ranks support each other."  I took a good friend out for what we thought was going to be a quick bite and catch up. She has kids, busy schedule, a demanding profession and the very least we expect is courteous respectful service. We both have agendas they keep us traveling and making appointments. Up until now Chipotle has always been a consistent restaurant choice for our busy lives. She was absolutely aghast at the experience the most recently had at the restaurant at CPCC in Charlotte North Carolina.  I am expecting hear from someone from corporate immediately. 704-294-1143  Larry

8ukII7GZEyK6wDj2BvhfvQ.text: I don't recommend ordering online for delivery because they make too many mistakes. Today the chicken bowl had no chicken. Last time I paid extra for queso and there was none on the bowl. There is usually something wrong when we order. Either go in and order in store to make sure you're actually getting what you pay for or go to a different location that gets the orders done correctly.

8NKikEEyvb2X7zQWNtmdew.text: Had a horrible and very rude experience tonight.  The customer service was horrible and very rude.  The steak was rubbery and at 7:30pm when I asked for chips the rude girl at the Register said "We ain't got any".  She did not tell us the total and just swiped the card. This was one of the worst customer service experiences i have had.  Chipotle is one of my go to places, but after this experience it has definitely made me changed my mind.

K4734EFzrsN1eLn-F9l8YA.text: only problem i had - i ordered a veggie bowl with extra veggie toppings on door dash and got a few green peppers. this is more of a menu complaint, you can't call it a veggie bowl when you're only serving one vegetable. otherwise great experience

ewwGm6hvC_aF0vk6chwBUg.text: It was hot today. I was so grateful to stop in to the wonderfully air conditioned Chipotle.   My party and I were lucky enough to be the store manager himself. Hector was very accommodating and his team served us happily and efficiently, providing me with the burrito I know and love so well.  Thanks team!

3LbhZSuLC38_K06eGF_nZQ.text: If you've been to a Chipotle before, this one won't disappoint! The food is standard, good chipotle but the line moved quickly and we were in and out quickly.

ZQZajQMYK3bkQN0R7uyz_A.text: I've tried to give this Chipotle multiple chances. This is it ...this bowl is so salty I couldn't finish it ! The guacamole is so salty I had to throw the rest away considering it was smothered with it . Normally no one would dare complain about too much guacamole, but when it taste like the top of the salt shaker fell off no bueno ! Won't be returning last straw.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Charlotte, NC, United States

OjmIakaQl8INui85LUlb3w.text: 1- catering order was 25 mins late and forgot the rice. 2- tried calling the store for 25 mins and got no answer- called 10+ times to check on delivery could not reach one person. When order finally showed without rice, tried calling again for 30 more mins- got NO answer. Then called another store- 2109 South Blvd and they answered right away. I explained my catering issue and the AMAZING INDIA- got  in her car and brought the rice to my office within minutes! She was very nice and apologized for the terrible customer service at the Kings drive location.   The kings drive location was so unprofessional, slow and of course very unreliable. If it wasn't for India- I would have never use Chipotle catering for my office meetings again. Its an embarrassment and inconvenience when your catering for important meeting and then the food ruins the vibe before the meeting even started. Kings drive Chipotle - bad business!  Thank you India from the South blvd store!

K918lAK48NjVAiXTZVgYkQ.text: Normally when I come to this Chipotle, which is often, there isn't an issue, but this time when my wife and I went to eat there it was at 9:15 and they close 10:00 on a Saturday. As we ordered our food, there was no steak and no Pico de gallo. The two most important add ons to our meal. Not only that, there were still multiple people coming in to order as well. In my option, there should be no excuse not to make fresh toppings for us. The staff also informed us that they were done making them for the night. Hopefully this is corrected for other customers.

RSRxO9t5JRFfXApaNAlmRA.text: They have really turned things around here. I am able to now walk in and get out within 5-10 minutes even during the lunch rush.   The employees have a sense of urgency that was not experienced in the past. They seem like they are truly working hard to provide the best customer experience. There is no more slow moving lines with uninterested employees talking and not paying attention.   This chipotle is now more fitting of what I expect based on experience with other locations. The only thing I think still needs work is keeping up with the demand. There are still times where things like veggies are unavailable because more have not been made until they are completely out. Fixing that and making more in anticipation of the rush would give them that final star from me.   But all around I am much more pleased than any of my past experiences with this location.
